summary: Completed comprehensive backend testing of real-time overage billing implementation. All 7 API endpoint tests and 7 implementation verification checks passed successfully (100% success rate). Verified that overage billing now happens immediately on call_ended webhook instead of 5-minute Celery polling, with proper integration and system stability.
passed_tests: Backend Health Check: Django ASGI backend responding with HTTP 200
POST /api/webhook/retell with event=call_started - Returns 200 OK with proper status response
POST /api/webhook/retell with event=call_ended - Returns 200 OK and triggers real-time billing logic
POST /api/dtmf/supervisor-check - Returns 200 with proper result/message format for unknown calls
POST /api/time-check - Returns 200 with all required fields (current_time, timezone, is_business_hours)
Real-time overage function integration - Webhook processes overage scenarios without errors
System stability after Celery schedule changes - Backend remains stable with hourly charge-overage task
_charge_overage_realtime function exists in webhooks.py with proper signature
All required imports present: OveragePricingTable, UserTransactionLogs, TransactionType, check_user_balance
Celery beat schedule changed from 300s to 3600s (hourly safety-net) for charge_user_for_additional_minutes
Proper logging and error handling implemented in _charge_overage_realtime function
Django backend running healthy on port 8001 with CloudFlare proxy integration
